What causes Thumb Arthritis (CMC-1): Complete Guide?

Causes and risk factors

 

 
 Genetics (39-65% hereditary)

 Heredity is by far the most important factor. If your mother has thumb arthritis, your risk is
 significantly increased.

 

 
 Gender

 Women are affected 2-3 times more often than men. Hormones and joint laxity play a role.

 

 
 Age

 Most common after 50, but X-ray findings can be found as early as the 40s.

 

 
 Load

 Heavy manual work and repetitive gripping movements over time increase risk somewhat. This is similar
 to the causation pattern for mouse arm and other overuse conditions in the arm.

Hvor har du vondt? Finn din smertetype: I stedet for å liste opp diagnoser, starter jeg med det du faktisk merker: hvor sitter smerten? Dette gir ofte den beste pekepinnen på hva som er galt.

Gjør-det-selv tester: Finn ut mer får du kommer: Før du bestiller time, kan du prøve disse enkle testene hjemme. De gir ofte en god pekepinn på hva som er galt å og gjør at jeg kommer raskere til bunns i problemet.

Hofte, rygg eller bekken? Slik skiller du dem: Mange som kommer til meg tror de har «hofteproblemer» å men smertene kommer egentlig fra ryggen eller bekkenet. Og omvendt. Her er tommelfingerreglene
MR-fellen: Hvorfor bildet ikke alltid stemmer: «MR viser at jeg har en rift » trenger jeg operasjon?å

Akutt selvhjelp: Hva du kan gjøre nå: Mens du venter på behandling, er det viktig å ikke irritere vevet unådig. Her er «brannslukkingstiltakene» jeg anbefaler
Behandling: Konservativ vs. kirurgi: Mange tror at énoe må gjøreså å helst raskt, helst en sprøyte eller operasjon. Men forskningen forteller en annen historie: for de fleste hofte- og bekkensmerter er trening og manuell behandling like bra eller bedre enn invasive tiltak.

Hva er prognosen for Svimmel når du legger deg? Dette bør du vite om krystallsyke?

Prognose

 

 
 Med behandling: Utsiktene er generelt svært gode. Over 90% oppnår full symptomlindring med riktig behandling. Mange merker betydelig bedring umiddelbart etter reposisjonsmanøveren.

 

 
 Uten behandling

 Krystallsyke går ofte over av seg selv, men det tar tid: bare 4% er bra etter én uke, 18% etter én måned, og 51% etter ett år. Med tanke på hvor plagsom tilstanden er, gir behandling vesentlig raskere bedring.

 

 
 Tilbakefall

 Det er viktig å være forberedt på at krystallsyke kan komme tilbake:

 
 10-18% får tilbakefall innen ett år

 Ca. 22% innen fem år

 Opp mot 50% over 10 år

 
 Høyere risiko for tilbakefall ses hos personer med migrene, diabetes, høyt blodtrykk, osteoporose og D-vitaminmangel. D-vitamintilskudd kan redusere tilbakefallsrisikoen betydelig.

 Medical Treatment of Migraine

 For chronic migraine: Botox or CGRP inhibitors

Beskriv Ofte stilte spørsmål for GTPS - Smerter på Utsiden av Hoften.

Ofte stilte spørsmål

 

 
 Hva er forskjellen på GTPS og trokanter bursitt?

 GTPS er en samlebetegnelse som inkluderer gluteal tendinopati, bursitt og muskeldysfunksjon. Forskning viser at det meste av smertene skyldes seneproblemer, ikke bursitt. Behandlingen er lik uansett.

 

 
 Hvor lang tid tar det å bli bra?

 GTPS tar ofte 6-9 måneder å behandle effektivt. LEAP-studien viste at 79% var bedre etter 1 Ør med riktig treningsbehandling. Varre først er ikke uvanlig.

 

 
 Bør jeg unngå å ligge på den vonde siden?

 Ja, i den akutte fasen. Sideligging komprimerer senene mot trokanter. Bruk en pute mellom knarne eller ligg på den friske siden. Gradvis tilvenning etter hvert som smertene avtar.

 

 
 Hjelper toying?

 Var forsiktig med toying. Mange tøyeØvelser komprimerer senene og kan gjøre vondt verre. Fokuser heller på styrketrening.

 

 
 Kan jeg fortsette å trene?

 Ja, men du må tilpasse treningen. Unngå Øvelser som gir mye smerte, særlig i ytterstillinger. Aktiviteter som sykling og svomming tolereres ofte godt.

Describe The Drawbacks and Risks for Cortisone Injection in Shoulder: Friend or Foe?.

The Drawbacks and Risks

 

 Research in recent years has shown that cortisone isn't as innocent as previously thought. Here's what
 you should know:

 
 Documented risks with repeated use

 
 Tendon weakening: Cortisone inhibits collagen synthesis and can weaken tendon
 tissue over time

 Increased risk of rupture: Studies show increased risk of tendon rupture after
 multiple injections

 Cartilage damage: Cortisone can accelerate cartilage breakdown in joints

 Fat tissue atrophy: Can cause local loss of subcutaneous fat

 Pigment changes: Lighter skin at the injection site

 
 

 Short-lived effect

 One of the biggest limitations is that the effect is often temporary:

 
 
 What research shows

 

 
 At 6-8 weeks, the effect begins to wear off in most people

 At 3 months, there's often no difference from placebo

 At 6-12 months, those who received cortisone may actually have worse outcomes than the control
 group

 The condition often returns if the underlying cause isn't addressed

 
 

 
 "Cortisone flare"

 About 2-5% experience temporary worsening of pain in the first 24-48 hours after injection. This is
 called a "cortisone flare" and is caused by a crystal reaction. It resolves on its own but can be
 uncomfortable.

 

 The problem with tendinopathy

 For chronic tendon irritation (tendinopathy), cortisone is particularly problematic:

 
 Tendinopathy is not primarily an inflammatory condition - it's degenerative

 Cortisone can interfere with the natural repair ...

Beskriv Stol og sittestilling for Skuldervennlig kontorplass: Slik setter du opp arbeidsstasjonen.

Stol og sittestilling

 

 En god stol og riktig justering legger grunnlaget for en avslappet skulderposisjon:

 
 Stolhøyde

 
 Fåttene bør stå flatt i gulvet (eller på fotskammel)

 Knårne bør våre i ca. 90 graders vinkel eller litt mer

 Larene bør våre omtrent parallelle med gulvet

 
 

 
 Armlener

 
 Armlenene bør støtte underarmene slik at skuldrene kan våre avslappet

 Juster høyden slik at skuldrene verken løftes eller trekkes nedover

 Armlenene bør ikke hindre deg i å komme når nok pulten

 Noen foretrekker ingen armlener - da slipper de å sitte for langt fra pulten

 
 

 
 Ryggstotte

 Ryggstotten bør støtte korsryggen (lendaryggen). En god lendestotte hjelper deg å opprettholde naturlig kurvatur i ryggen, noe som igjen gjør det lettere å holde en avslappet skulderposisjon.

 

 
 Den beste sittestillingen

 Viktigere enn "perfekt" stilling er variasjon. Det finnes ikke en posisjon som er ideell i timevis. Bytt mellom å sitte fremoverlent, bakover lent, og oppreist. Reis deg og beveg deg regelmessig. Den neste stillingen er alltid den beste stillingen. Ved vedvarende smerter, vurder om det kan våre en underliggende tilstand som kalkskulder eller TOS (thoracic outlet syndrome).

Differential diagnoses for Scoliosis – Curved Spine in Children and Adults?

Adams Forward Bend Test

 The gold standard for screening. The patient bends forward with straight knees and arms hanging down. The examiner looks for asymmetry – particularly a "rib hump" caused by vertebral rotation. The test is simple and can be performed by parents at home.

Scoliometer

 An instrument that measures the degree of rotation in degrees during the Adams test. Over 7 degrees warrants further investigation with X-rays.

Full Postural Assessment

 We assess shoulder and hip height, leg lengths, and perform neurological screening to rule out neuromuscular causes.

X-ray – Cobb Angle

 Standing full-spine X-ray is the gold standard for measuring the Cobb angle and evaluating the curve pattern. The Risser sign is assessed simultaneously in children and adolescents to estimate remaining growth. Chiropractors can refer for X-rays directly.

MRI

 MRI is not routine for scoliosis. It is used for neurological symptoms (weakness, numbness, altered gait), left-sided thoracic curve (atypical pattern), painful scoliosis without explanation, or suspected syringomyelia, tumor, or Chiari malformation.

Explain PCL Injury to a patient.

The posterior cruciate ligament (PCL) is the strongest ligament in the knee, yet it's much less
 talked about than the ACL . PCL injuries are less common but can occur
 with direct trauma to the shin or a fall on a bent knee.

 The good news? Most isolated PCL injuries can be treated without surgery. The knee
 often adapts well, and many return to high activity levels with rehabilitation. PCL injury is one of
 the less common causes of knee pain .

Describe symptoms and signs of Posterior Canal BPPV: When the World Spins Backwards.

Symptoms

 

 The characteristic symptom of posterior canal BPPV is short, intense episodes of rotational dizziness triggered by specific head movements.

 Typical Triggering Movements:

 
 Lying down in bed

 Rolling over in bed from side to side

 Tilting the head backward (looking up at the ceiling)

 Bending forward to pick something up from the floor

 

 Characteristics of Symptoms:

 
 
 10-60 sec
 Typical duration
 

 
 1-5 sec
 Latency after movement
 

 
 80-90%
 Of BPPV cases
 

 

 
 Accompanying Symptoms

 Nausea, sweating, and unsteadiness are common. BPPV normally does not cause hearing loss, tinnitus (ringing in the ears), or neurological symptoms.

Beskriv Øvelser ved pulten for Skuldervennlig kontorplass: Slik setter du opp arbeidsstasjonen.

Øvelser ved pulten

 

 Disse enkle Øvelsene kan du gjøre sittende ved pulten eller stående ved siden av. De tar bare 30-60 sekunder hver:

 
 1. Skulderruller

 Rull skuldrene bakover i store sirkler. Start med å løfte skuldrene mot orene, deretter trekk dem bakover, ned og frem igjen. Gjenta 10 ganger.

 30 sekunder
 

 
 2. Nakkestretch

 Bøy hodet forsiktig til den ene siden (Øret mot skulderen). Hold i 15-20 sekunder. Gjenta til den andre siden. Ikke roter hodet, bare sidebøyning.

 40 sekunder
 

 
 3. Brystapning

 Len deg tilbake i stolen, Åpne armene ut til sidene og press brystkassen fremover. Klem skulderbladene sammen. Hold i 10 sekunder, gjenta 3 ganger.

 30 sekunder
 

 
 4. Skulderblad-squeeze

 Trekk skulderbladene sammen som om du prøver å holde en blyant mellom dem. Hold i 5 sekunder, slipp. Gjenta 10 ganger.

 50 sekunder
 

 
 5. Hakeinntrending (Chin tuck)

 Trekk haken rett bakover (dobbelhake-bevegelse) mens du ser rett frem. Hold i 5 sekunder. Dette motvirker fremoverlent hodestilling. Gjenta 10 ganger.

 50 sekunder
 

 
 6. Armer over hodet

 Strekk begge armene rett opp over hodet. Pust inn, strekk deg så høyt du kan. Pust ut, senk armene. Gjenta 5 ganger.

 30 sekunder
 

 
 Gjor dette til en vane

 Velg 2-3 av Øvelsene og gjør dem hver gang du tar en mikropause. Over tid blir det automatisk, og skuldrene vil takke deg.

Beskriv årsaker og risikofaktorer for Plantar Fasciopati.

Årsaker og risikofaktorer

 Forskning har identifisert flere risikofaktorer, rangert etter hvor sterkt de påvirker sjansen for å utvikle tilstanden
 Begrenset ankelmobilitet

 23x økt risiko ved null grader dorsalfleksjon eller mindre (Riddle et al., JBJS 2003)

 Overvekt (BMI > 30)

 5-6x økt risiko sammenlignet med normalvektige

 Yrker med mye ståing

 4x økt risiko ved å stå mesteparten av arbeidsdagen

 Fotstruktur

 Både flat fot og høy fotbue kan øke belastningen på plantarfascien

 Plutselig økning i aktivitet - som å begynne å løpe etter lang pause, eller – Øke treningsmengden for raskt - er en klassisk utløsende faktor. Denne typen overbelastning kan også føre til stressfrakturer i foten.

Describe causes and risk factors for Popliteus Syndrome.

Causes and Risk Factors

 Popliteus syndrome usually develops gradually as a result of overuse
 Downhill Running
 Most common
 cause 

 During downhill running, the popliteus must work hard to control knee flexion and prevent
 hyperextension. Trail running and hiking are typical triggers.

 Overload

 Too rapid increase in training volume, intensity, or change in surface can overload the popliteus
 before it has time to adapt.

 Biomechanical Factors

 Overpronation

 Weak hip muscles

 Tight hamstrings or calves

 Poor knee control

Symptoms

 

 The most common symptoms of chronic ankle instability:

 
 "Giving way": The ankle suddenly gives out, especially on uneven surfaces

 Repeated sprains: New rolling incidents even with little provocation

 When should you seek help?

 You avoid activities you previously enjoyed

 Pain or swelling that doesn't resolve

 Locking or clicking in the ankle joint

 Men angst som følge av svimmelhet er ikke det samme som at svimmelheten "bare er psykisk". En grundig undersøkelse vil avdekke om det finnes underliggende vestibulære eller muskuloskeletale Årsaker.

Describe What Can You Do Yourself? for Sinus Headache or Migraine?.

What Can You Do Yourself?

 

 For Migraine

 
 Headache diary: Record attacks, triggers, food, sleep, and menstruation. This helps you identify patterns.

 Regularity: Keep fixed times for sleep, meals, and activity. Migraine brains like predictability. Sleep problems can also cause morning headache.

 Trigger control: Avoid known triggers, but be aware that "trigger hunting" can become excessive.

 Acute treatment: Pain relievers work best when taken early in the attack. Overuse (more than 10-15 days per month) can lead to medication overuse headache.

 

 For Suspected Sinusitis

 
 Saline rinse: Nasal irrigation with saline can relieve symptoms.

 Humid air: Steam inhalation or a humidifier can help with dryness.

 Nasal spray: Decongestant nasal spray for short periods (max 7-10 days for decongestant types).

 Wait and see: Most viral sinusitis resolves in 7-10 days without treatment.

Symptomer

 Symptomene ved prepatellar bursitt er ofte tydelige og karakteristiske
 Hovedsymptomer

 Hevelse: Tydelig, lokalisert hevelse direkte over kneskailen - ofte beskrevet som "en ball foran kneet"

 Funksjonelle symptomer

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Dizzy and Nauseous - Causes, Treatment and When to Seek Help.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 How long does nausea last with dizziness?

 It depends on the cause. With BPPV, nausea typically lasts seconds to minutes after head movement. With vestibular neuritis, nausea can persist for days. With migraine, it can last for hours.

 

 
 Can stress cause dizziness and nausea?

 Yes. Stress and anxiety can cause hyperventilation which causes dizziness. Additionally, 30-50% of dizziness patients are also affected by anxiety or depression - this is a biological connection, not "imagined."

 

 
 Is dizziness and nausea dangerous?

 Usually not. Most causes are benign and treatable. But acute dizziness with neurological symptoms (paralysis, speech difficulties, visual disturbances) can be signs of stroke and requires immediate medical evaluation.

 

 
 What helps against nausea?

 Treat the cause of dizziness. With BPPV, repositioning maneuver gives rapid improvement. During attacks, it can help to lie still, focus on a fixed point, and take deep breaths. Anti-nausea medications can be used short-term but should not be used for more than 2-3 days as they can delay healing.

 Chiropractor typically uses

 
 Joint manipulation: Quick, precise adjustments of joints

 Physiotherapist typically uses

 
 Exercise therapy: Often main focus

 Manual treatment: Massage and mobilization

 Electrotherapy: TENS, ultrasound, etc.

 Rehabilitation: After injuries and surgeries

 Specialized fields: Neurological, cardiopulmonary, pediatric physiotherapy

 
 

 
 Manual therapists (physiotherapists with additional education) also use joint manipulation.

Describe Differential Diagnoses - What Can It Resemble? for Superior Canal Dehiscence Syndrome (SCDS).

Differential Diagnoses - What Can It Resemble?

 

 SCDS is called "the great imitator of the ear" because symptoms can resemble several other conditions:

 
 Meniere's Disease

 Also causes hearing loss and dizziness, but attacks come spontaneously and last 20 minutes to several hours. In SCDS, symptoms are temporally related to specific sound or pressure triggers.

 

 
 BPPV (Crystal Disease)

 Triggered by head movements and causes brief spinning dizziness that diminishes with repeated movements. SCDS is triggered by sound and pressure, not head position.

 

 
 Otosclerosis

 Also causes hearing loss in low frequencies, but in otosclerosis the stapedius reflex is absent - in SCDS it is normal. This difference is important because stapedectomy (surgery for otosclerosis) is contraindicated in SCDS.

Beskriv Øvelser for de Første Dagene for Akutt Ryggsmerte: Hva Du Bør Gjøre de Første Timene og Dagene.

Øvelser for de Første Dagene

 

 
 1. Bekkenrulling (Liggende)

 
 Ligg på ryggen med bøyde knær og føttene i gulvet

 Rull bekkenet forsiktig frem (korsryggen flater ut mot underlaget)

 Rull bekkenet tilbake (korsryggen får litt svai)

 10 repetisjoner, 3 ganger daglig

 
 

 
 2. Kne-til-Bryst

 
 Ligg på ryggen med bøyde knær

 Trekk forsiktig ett kne mot brystet

 Hold i 20-30 sekunder

 Bytt side. Gjenta 3 ganger per side.

 
 

 
 3. Cat-Camel

 
 Stå på alle fire med hendene under skuldrene og knærne under hoftene

 Bue ryggen opp mot taket (katt) - slipp hodet ned

 Svaie ryggen ned (kamel) - løft hodet

 Beveg forsiktig gjennom smertefritt område, 10 repetisjoner

 
 

 
 4. Sideliggende Rotasjon

 
 Ligg på siden med bøyde knær

 Roter overkroppen forsiktig mot taket

 Hold i 10 sekunder

 Bytt side

Describe symptoms for Vestibular Hypofunction: The Complete Guide.

Symptoms

 Symptoms in Unilateral Hypofunction

 Symptom 
 Prevalence 

 Chronic dizziness 
 98% 

 Imbalance/unsteadiness 
 81% 

 Worsening with head movements 
 75% 

 Oscillopsia (unstable vision during movement) 
 22-70% 

 Fatigue/exhaustion 
 68% 

 Symptoms in Bilateral Hypofunction

 Bilateral hypofunction gives a characteristic symptom triad
 1. Unsteadiness When Walking and Standing

 The main complaint, especially on uneven surfaces, in darkness or with head movements. Many describe feeling like they're "walking on a boat."

 2. Oscillopsia - When the World Jumps

 Often the most bothersome symptom. The visual image "jumps" with head movements. About 70% experience this.

 3. Symptom-Free at Rest

 Symptoms disappear when you sit or lie still. This distinguishes bilateral hypofunction from other causes.

 4. No Spinning Dizziness

 Rarely classic vertigo because both sides are equally weak - there is no imbalance creating the sensation of rotation.

 Red Flags - When You Must Seek Medical Help Immediately

 Call emergency services or go to the emergency room immediately for
 Acute dizziness combined with headache, neck pain or recent trauma

 Speech difficulties, swallowing difficulties or unclear speech

 Paralysis, numbness or weakness in face, arm or leg

 Double vision or visual field loss

 Altered consciousness or confusion

 Up to 25% of acute dizziness cases at the emergency room may be caused by stroke in the posterior brain circulation.

Describe causes of dizziness in elderly for Dizziness in Elderly and Fall Risk.

Causes of Dizziness in Elderly

 BPPV - 20-46% of Cases

 By far the most common cause of dizziness in elderly. Small calcium crystals become dislodged in the inner ear and disturb balance signals. Typically causes brief, intense dizziness with head movements.

 In elderly, symptoms may be less typical. Many experience only general unsteadiness rather than the classic "carousel feeling." Therefore, the condition is often overlooked.

 Medication Side Effects

 Many elderly take 5-10 different medications daily. The side effects - or combination of them - are a frequent cause of dizziness. The worst offenders include
 Blood pressure medications (can cause too low pressure when standing)

 Sleep medications and sedatives

 Antidepressants

 Diuretics

 Multisensory Deficits

 Balance depends on three systems: vision, balance organ, and sensation in the feet. With age, all three weaken slightly. Cataracts reduce vision, hair cells in the inner ear gradually die (presbyvestibulopathy), and nerve signals from the feet are slower.

 Orthostatic Hypotension

 Blood pressure drop when standing up. Common in elderly, especially those taking blood pressure medications.

Describe WAD Classification (Quebec Task Force) for Whiplash.

WAD Classification (Quebec Task Force)

 

 
 
 
 Grade
 Description
 
 
 
 
 WAD 0
 No neck complaints or clinical findings
 
 
 WAD I
 Neck complaints (pain, stiffness, tenderness) without clinical findings
 
 
 WAD II
 Neck complaints with musculoskeletal findings (reduced mobility, point tenderness) - most common
 (~82%)
 
 
 WAD III
 Neck complaints with neurological findings (reduced reflexes, weakness, sensory deficits)
 
 
 WAD IV
 Fracture or dislocation - requires immediate medical evaluation
 
 
 
 The vast majority have WAD grade II. Headache, dizziness, tinnitus, and jaw problems can occur at all
 grades.

Beskriv Hvorfor så mange blir feildiagnostisert for Når svimmelheten ikke passer inn: Er det BPPV eller noe annet?.

Hvorfor så mange blir feildiagnostisert

 

 Feildiagnostisering av svimmelhet er utbredt. På akuttmottak blir 74-81% av perifere vestibulære lidelser (inkludert BPPV) oversett.

 Atypiske BPPV-presentasjoner

 37-41% av BPPV-pasienter har ikke klassisk "alt spinner rundt"-opplevelse. Mange beskriver heller:

 
 Nautisk eller vuggende følelse

 Tåkete tankegang ("brain fog")

 Generell ustadighet mellom anfall

 Vedvarende "lett i hodet"-følelse

 

 Diagnostiske tester har begrensninger

 Dix-Hallpike testen for BPPV har kun 48-88% sensitivitet. Negativ test utelukker ikke diagnosen.

 Overlappende tilstander

 Vestibulær migrene og BPPV kan eksistere samtidig. Migrenepasienter har tre ganger høyere BPPV-risiko, og 25% av vestibulær migrene-pasienter rapporterer posisjonssvimmelhet.

Describe Injury Grading for Ankle Sprains.

Injury Grading

 

 Ankle sprains are classified into three grades based on severity:

 
 
 Grade I (mild)

 Mild stretching, minimal swelling, can bear weight1-3 weeks healing

 

 
 Grade II (moderate)

 Partial tear, moderate swelling, reduced stability3-6 weeks healing

 

 
 Grade III (severe)

 Complete tear, significant instability6-12 weeks or more

 

 

 
 Diagnosis

 Clinical examination is the cornerstone. Ottawa Ankle Rules have 97.6% sensitivity for
 detecting fractures and are used to determine if X-ray is necessary. This approach reduces unnecessary
 X-rays by 30-40%.

 X-ray is only indicated with bone tenderness along the posterior edge of the
 ankle bones or inability to take four steps. With persistent pain after a sprain, stress fracture should be ruled out.

Describe Two types of Eagle syndrome for Eagle Syndrome.

Two types of Eagle syndrome

 

 
 Classic Eagle syndrome

 Most often after tonsillectomy. Symptoms:

 
 Dysphagia (difficulty swallowing)

 Odynophagia (painful swallowing)

 Sensation of foreign body in throat

 Ear pain (otalgia)

 Throat pain radiating to ear

 
 

 
 Stylocarotid syndrome (Vascular type)

 Compression of the carotid artery. This is the serious variant:

 
 Transient ischemic attacks (TIA)

 Syncope with head rotation

 Visual disturbances

 Headache

 Dizziness

 
 Important: The stylocarotid variant is serious and can cause stroke. With TIA symptoms or syncope during head movements, the patient should be referred immediately for vascular evaluation.

Describe symptoms and signs of Bra Strap Syndrome and Shoulder Pain.

Symptoms

 

 The typical symptom pattern has a characteristic pattern:

 
 Typical Symptoms

 
 Shoulder and neck pain - often on both sides, but can be worse on one side

 Pain is minimal in the morning and gradually worsens throughout the day

 Relief when the bra is removed - this is an important diagnostic sign

 Numbness or tingling down the arm (due to nerve compression)

 Visible grooves or marks where the straps sit

 Headache - often from the back of the head and upward

 Fatigue in the shoulders, especially during prolonged standing or carrying bags

 
 

 
 Important Diagnostic Sign

 Symptom relief when the bra is removed, and worsening throughout the day, distinguishes bra strap
 syndrome from other shoulder/neck problems.

Describe The Alternative: Train Your Feet Stronger for Do You Really Need Orthotics?.

The Alternative: Train Your Feet Stronger

 

 While orthotics show weak results, foot training has surprisingly strong effects:

 
 
 57%
 strength increase in 6 months
 

 
 2.4x
 fewer running injuries
 

 
 8-17%
 energy storage in the arch
 

 

 
 Liverpool Study (Curtis 2021)

 Showed that 6 months of minimalist shoes increased foot strength by 57.4% - without specific exercises.

 

 
 Taddei et al. (2020)

 Found that runners who trained their feet had less than half as many injuries.

 

 The foot arch functions as a spring - it stores 8-17% of mechanical energy with each running step (Stearne 2016). Orthotics that limit arch movement increase metabolic cost by up to 6%.

Describe treatment options for Eagle Syndrome.

Treatment

 

 Conservative treatment

 Can be tried as first measure:

 
 Conservative options

 
 Pain relievers: NSAIDs

 Anticonvulsants: Carbamazepine or gabapentin for neuralgia component

 Steroid injection: Locally around styloid process

 Physiotherapy: Careful myofascial treatment

 Lifestyle modification: Avoid provoking movements

 
 

 Surgical treatment

 Styloidectomy (removal of styloid process) is considered for:

 
 Lack of response to conservative treatment

 Severe symptoms

 Vascular compression

 

 
 Surgical approaches

 
 Transoral: Through the mouth - shorter recovery, but limited visibility

 External (transcervical): Better visibility, recommended for vascular involvement

 
 

 
 Prognosis after surgery

 
 80-90% report significant improvement

 Complications are rare with experienced surgeons

 Symptom relief is often achieved within weeks after surgery

Patient asks: "What is menstrual migraine?"

Menstrual migraine refers to migraine attacks that consistently occur in connection with menstruation, typically from day -2 to day +3 of the cycle. Pure menstrual migraine means attacks only occur during this period, while menstrually-related migraine means attacks also occur at other times.

Beskriv symptomer for Tarsaltunnelsyndrom.

Symptomer

 Det klassiske bildet ved tarsaltunnelsyndrom er brennende smerter og kribling som følger nervens utbredelsesområde - fra bak ankelen, under foten og ut i tærne. Dette skiller seg tydelig fra Morton's nevrom som gir smerter mellom tærne.

 Vanlige symptomer

 Brennende smerte langs fotsålen, ofte inn mot tærne

 Kribling og nummenhet som kan ligne "maur under huden"

 Plagene øker ved ståing, gåing og løping

 Nattlige smerter som kan vekke deg - nerven reagerer på stillingen i sengen

 Lettelse ved hvile og når du tar av skoene

 Viktig å skille fra plantar fascitt

 Plantar fascitt gir verkende hælsmerte verst ved de første stegene om morgenen . Tarsaltunnelsyndrom gir brennende smerter med kribling som forverres med aktivitet. Noen pasienter har begge tilstandene samtidig.

Describe symptoms and signs of Cervical Foraminal Stenosis - Narrowed Nerve Canal in Neck.

Symptoms

 

 Typical Symptoms

 
 Radicular pain: Sharp, burning, or electric pain that radiates from neck to arm
 

 Numbness and tingling: Often in specific fingers depending on which nerve is
 affected

 Weakness: Reduced strength in specific arm or hand muscles

 Neck stiffness: Especially with movements that close the foramen (extension +
 rotation toward painful side)

 

 
 Spurling's Test

 A classic test for foraminal stenosis: The head
 is bent backward and rotated toward the painful side, then light pressure is applied downward. A
 positive test reproduces radiation to the arm. This "closes" the foramen and provokes symptoms.

Describe causes and risk factors for Fibromyalgia with Chest Pain.

Causes and risk factors

 Fibromyalgia has no single known cause. The condition likely involves several factors that together make
 the nervous system oversensitive. Stress and psychological burden often play a role, which can also affect
 breathing patterns and cause tension in the thoracic spine .

 What happens in the body?

 Central sensitization is the core of fibromyalgia. This means that the nervous system amplifies pain
 signals - like a volume knob turned up too high. Normal touch can be perceived as painful (allodynia), and
 mild stimuli feel intensely painful (hyperalgesia).

 Research has documented the following changes
 Elevated substance P (pain-transmitting substance) in spinal fluid

 Reduced serotonin, noradrenaline and dopamine

 Weakened natural pain inhibition from the brain

 Altered activity in brain areas that process pain (Gracely et al., 2002)

 Risk factors (ranked by evidence)

 A systematic review of 37 prospective cohort studies published in PAIN (Creed, 2020)
 Sleep disturbances/non-restorative sleep - strongest evidence

 Previous headache and other pain conditions 

 Depression 

 Illness behavior (excessive worry about symptoms)

 Female sex and middle age (40-60 years)

Describe What is thumb arthritis? for Thumb Arthritis (CMC-1): Complete Guide.

What is thumb arthritis?

 

 Thumb arthritis (CMC-1 arthritis, basal arthritis) is osteoarthritis in the joint at the base of the
 thumb - where the thumb meets the first metacarpal bone (carpometacarpal joint). This joint is
 particularly vulnerable because it gives the thumb its unique mobility, but also exposes it to great
 strain. The condition is sometimes confused with De Quervain's
 tenosynovitis or trigger finger, which also cause thumb problems.
 

 The joint has a "saddle shape" that allows movement in multiple planes. This enables gripping and
 squeezing powerfully, but also makes the joint unstable and vulnerable to wear over time.

 more often in women

Describe treatment options for Runner's Knee (PFPS) - How to Return to Full Distance.

Treatment

 

 Treatment of runner's knee focuses on addressing the underlying causes, not just the symptoms:

 1. Hip strengthening

 
 Key exercises

 
 Side-lying hip abduction: Focus on gluteus medius

 Clamshells: With resistance band for increased load

 Single-leg bridging: Functional hip activation

 Step-downs: Eccentric control

 
 

 2. Quadriceps strengthening

 Strengthening the quadriceps is important, but start in pain-free ranges and progress gradually to more
 knee flexion.

 3. Running form adjustments

 
 Increase cadence by 5-10%

 One of the well-documented single interventions! Higher cadence gives:

 
 Shorter stride length

 Less vertical force per step

 Reduced load on the patellofemoral joint

 
 Practical tip: Use a metronome app or run to music with the right BPM. Measure your
 current cadence first, then increase gradually.

 

 4. Load management

 
 Pain scale 0-10

 During running: Keep pain below 3/10

 After running: Pain should return to baseline within 24 hours

 If not - train a bit less next time

 

 5. Manual treatment

 
 Chiropractic care may include

 
 Mobilization of patella and knee joint

 Soft tissue techniques for tight muscles

 Treatment of hip and ankle

 Kinesio taping to support the kneecap

What is the prognosis for Posterior Canal BPPV: When the World Spins Backwards?

Prognosis

 

 BPPV generally has a very good prognosis. Most become symptom-free after treatment, and many experience spontaneous improvement even without treatment (median duration 2 weeks).

 Recurrence Is Common:

 
 15-40% experience recurrence within 1-2 years

 50% may experience recurrence over a 10-year period

 Recurrence most often occurs in the same ear and same canal

 

 
 New Treatment Is Equally Effective

 Although recurrence is common, new treatment is just as effective as the first treatment.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Sports Injuries - Complete Guide.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 How soon after injury should I seek treatment?

 For acute injuries, assessment within the first few days is ideal. Early intervention can speed recovery and prevent complications. For overuse injuries, seek help when pain affects your training or doesn't improve with modified activity.

 

 
 Can I continue training with a sports injury?

 Often yes, with modifications. Many injuries allow continued training at reduced intensity or with alternative activities. Complete rest is rarely necessary and can actually delay recovery. A chiropractor can guide appropriate modifications.

 

 
 Should I use ice or heat on my injury?

 For acute injuries (first 48-72 hours), ice can help manage pain and swelling. After the acute phase, heat may help with muscle relaxation. However, active movement and appropriate loading are more important than either.

 

 
 Do I need imaging for my sports injury?

 Not always. A thorough clinical examination often provides sufficient information to start treatment. Imaging may be recommended if there's suspected fracture, complete ligament tear, or if symptoms don't improve as expected.

 

 
 How do I know when I'm ready to return to sport?

 Return to sport should be based on function, not time. You should have full pain-free range of motion, adequate strength (usually 90%+ of uninjured side), and be able to perform sport-specific movements without symptoms.

 

 
 How can I prevent re-injury?

 Complete your rehab...

Beskriv Frossen skulder (adhesiv kapsulitt) for Skuldersmerter – Komplett guide.

Frossen skulder (adhesiv kapsulitt)

 

 Frossen skulder er en tilstand der leddkapselen rundt skulderen blir tykk, betent og stram. Det fører til gradvis Økende stivhet og smerte. Tilstanden går gjennom tre karakteristiske faser:

 
 Frysefasen (2-9 måneder)

 Gradvis Økende smerte og stivhet. Nattesmertene kan våre intense.

 

 
 Frossen fase (4-12 måneder)

 Smertene avtar noe, men stivheten er på sitt verste. Daglige aktiviteter blir vanskelige.

 

 
 Opptiningsfasen (6-24 måneder)

 Bevegeligheten kommer gradvis tilbake. Full bedring kan ta 1-3 Ør.

 

 
 Hvem får frossen skulder?

 Diabetes Øker risikoen betydelig å diabetikere har 5 ganger høyere sannsynlighet for å utvikle frossen skulder. Andre risikofaktorer er skjoldbruskkjertellidelser og langvarig inaktivitet etter skade eller operasjon.

 

 
 Prognose: Selv om det tar tid, gjenvinner 80% av pasientene god skulderfunksjon med riktig oppfølging. Tidlig behandling kan redusere alvorlighetsgrad og varighet.

Beskriv symptomer og kjennetegn for Krum Rygg og Dårlig Holdning.

Symptomer å mer enn bare utseende

 

 Krum rygg handler ikke bare om hvordan du ser ut. Mange opplever en rekke plager som de ikke kobler til holdningen:

 Nakke- og skulderproblemer

 Økt brystkrumning tvinger hodet fremover for å opprettholde horisontalt blikk. Dette overbelaster nakkemuskler og ledd, noe som kan føre til smerter mellom skulderbladene. Forskning viser at forward head posture medierer forholdet mellom brystkyfose og nedsatt nakkebevegelighet. Granito et al. (2012) dokumenterte at redusert brystmobilitet korrelerte med 23% redusert skulderbevegelighet.

 Hodepine

 Watson og Trott (1993) fant at 83% av pasienter med cervikogen hodepine hadde Økt brystkyfose (>40 grader). En studie fra 2023 på migrenepasienter viste signifikant høyere kyfosevinkel (57 grader vs 38 grader) sammenlignet med friske kontroller. Hodepinen kommer ofte fra overbelastede nakkestrukturer som kompenserer for brystkrumningen.

 Armsmerter og nummenhet

 Stiv brystrygg kan påvirke skulderbladsposisjon og nervefunksjon. En studie fant at 78% av tilfeller med tennisalbue eller golfalbue hadde samtidig stiv brystrygg. Nummenhet og prikking i hendene kan skyldes kompresjon eller strekk av nerver i den kinetiske kjeden.

 Tretthet og nedsatt funksjon

 å holde kroppen oppreist mot en krum rygg krever konstant muskelarbeid. Mange opplever uforklarlig tretthet. Ved alvorlig kyfose kan lungefunksjonen påvirkes fordi brystkassen komprimeres. For mer om sammenhengen mellom pust og rygg, se pust, ...

Differensialdiagnoser ved Nakkesmerter i Svangerskapet?

Hormonelle endringer (rammer alle gravide)

 Under svangerskapet produserer kroppen hormonet relaxin , som løsner opp leddbånd og bindevev for å forberede kroppen på fødsel. Relaxin-nivåene er høyest i første trimester, men hormonet blir værende i kroppen gjennom hele svangerskapet og flere måneder etter fødsel.

Holdningsendringer og tyngdepunktsforskyvning

 Etter hvert som magen vokser, forskyves kroppens tyngdepunkt fremover. For å kompensere lener mange gravide seg bakover, noe som fører til økt svai i korsryggen. Denne holdningsendringen forplanter seg oppover i ryggsøylen og påvirker nakken.

Vektøkning og brystforstørrelse

 Den naturlige vektøkningen i svangerskapet - typisk 10-16 kilo - legger ekstra press på alle vektbærende ledd. Brystene kan øke betraktelig i størrelse, noe som trekker skuldrene fremover og skaper spenninger i øvre rygg og nakke.

Søvnforstyrrelser

 God søvn blir vanskeligere utover i svangerskapet. Mange gravide sliter med å finne en komfortabel sovestilling, må opp flere ganger om natten, og har generelt urolig søvn. Dårlige soveposisjoner kan føre til stiv og smertefull nakke om morgenen.

Assess red flags: 45-year-old female with chronic neck pain, regular follow-up. Today reports episodes of numbness and weakness in right arm AND right leg lasting 10-15 minutes, resolving completely. Happened 3 times in past month. "My arm just falls asleep."

URGENCY: REFER SAME-DAY

RED FLAGS IDENTIFIED: Possible TIA (transient ischemic attack) — misattributed to neck problems.

Clinical reasoning:
- Chronic neck pain is a separate, known condition
- BUT: episodic, SIMULTANEOUS arm + leg weakness on SAME side = not cervical radiculopathy
- Cervical radiculopathy: causes arm symptoms ALONE (single level), NOT arm+leg
- Ipsilateral arm + leg (hemiparesis) = central nervous system pathology
- Transient episodes (10-15 min) with full recovery = classic TIA
- TIA is warning sign for stroke (30% risk within 90 days without treatment)

ACTION: Do NOT perform cervical manipulation. Emergency department SAME DAY. CT/MRI brain, CT angiography neck vessels, ECG. Neurological assessment. Antiplatelet therapy may be needed.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for When Orthotics Actually Help.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Who benefits from orthotics?

 Patients with diabetic neuropathy, rheumatoid arthritis and symptomatic pes cavus have strong evidence for benefit. Additionally, orthotics can be used temporarily for acute injuries and postoperative rehabilitation.

 

 
 Are custom orthotics worth the price?

 For most conditions, research shows no difference between custom and prefabricated orthotics. The exception is complex deformities or special medical needs where precise customization is critical.

 

 
 Do orthotics work for overpronation?

 Evidence is weak. Large studies (Nielsen 2013) showed no difference in injury rates when runners got shoes matched to foot type versus neutral shoes. "Overpronation" as a diagnosis lacks scientific basis.

 

 
 Can I wean off orthotics?

 Yes, for many people gradual weaning combined with foot exercises is a good alternative. But it should be done gradually over several months. If you have diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis or severe deformities, you should continue with orthotics.

 

 
 Why do so many prescribe orthotics without evidence?

 Several factors are at play: tradition, commercial interests, and genuine misunderstandings about foot biomechanics. Many practitioners learned that orthotics were standard treatment - research has since shown this is often not the case.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Anterior Canal BPPV: The Rare Variant.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Can anterior canal BPPV be confused with neck-related dizziness?

 Yes, this is a common differential diagnosis. A positive response to the Supine Head Hanging Test with characteristic downbeat nystagmus suggests anterior canal BPPV. Cervicogenic dizziness typically produces no specific nystagmus.

 

 
 Why is anterior canal BPPV so rare?

 The anterior canal's vertical orientation makes it difficult for crystals to enter the canal against gravity. The same orientation also promotes spontaneous drainage of any crystals.

 

 
 Is downbeat nystagmus always anterior canal BPPV?

 No. Downbeat nystagmus can also be caused by central causes (cerebellar disease), apogeotropic posterior canal BPPV, or vestibular migraine. Correct differential diagnosis is essential.

 

 
 Can I get anterior canal BPPV after treatment for posterior canal BPPV?

 Yes, this is called canal conversion and can occur when crystals move to another canal during treatment.

Describe What Can You Do Yourself? for Foot and Ankle Problems.

What Can You Do Yourself?

 

 Activity and targeted exercises are often the most important treatment for foot problems. Here are evidence-based exercises for common conditions:

 
 1. Calf Stretching (Plantar Fasciopathy)

 Stand with your forefoot on a step, letting the heel hang over the edge. Lower slowly until you feel a stretch in the calf and Achilles. Hold 30-60 seconds. Repeat 3 times on each side. Do twice daily.

 

 
 2. Eccentric Heel Raises (Achilles Tendinopathy)

 Stand on tiptoes with both feet. Lift one foot and lower slowly on the affected side until the heel is below the step. Use the healthy leg to push up again. 3 sets of 15 repetitions, twice daily for 12 weeks.

 

 
 3. Balance Training (Ankle Instability)

 Stand on one leg with eyes open. Progress to: eyes closed, unstable surface, catching/throwing a ball. 3 sets of 30 seconds on each leg, daily. Reduces re-injury risk by 35%.

 

 
 4. Towel Scrunches (General Foot Strength)

 Sit with a towel under your foot. Use your toes to scrunch the towel towards you. Repeat 10-15 times, 2-3 sets. Strengthens the intrinsic muscles of the foot.

 

 
 The Key: Optimal Loading

 The goal is "optimal loading": enough load to stimulate healing, but not so much that you worsen the injury. Complete rest is rarely the solution. I provide specific advice tailored to your situation.

Symptoms

 Symptoms vary depending on the type of injury, size, and whether it develops acutely or gradually.

 Typical symptoms

 Pain with arm use: Especially when lifting the arm out to the side or overhead

 Painful arc: Pain between 60-120 degrees of elevation (classic sign)

 Night pain: Often the most bothersome symptom. Difficult to lie on the affected shoulder

 Weakness: May be noticed as difficulty holding the arm up or lifting objects

 Crepitus: Grinding or clicking with movement

 Acute traumatic tear

 Seek help quickly 

 Sudden, severe pain after a fall or lift

 Immediate weakness — unable to lift the arm

 Often a sensation of something "tearing" or "snapping"

 Rapid swelling and bruising

 Gradual (degenerative) onset

 Most common 

 Insidious onset without a clear triggering event

 Gradually increasing pain over weeks to months

 Often worse at night and when resting on the shoulder

 Weakness may be mild and almost imperceptible at first

Hva er prognosen for Vestibulær Migrene: Når Svimmelheten Tar Over Livet?

Prognose

 

 Med riktig behandling opplever de fleste betydelig bedring. Pasienter på forebyggende behandling får reduksjon i både frekvens, intensitet og varighet av anfallene.

 Realistiske forventninger:

 
 Tilbakefall er vanlig: Selv med god behandling vil mange oppleve perioder med flere anfall

 Behandlingen tar tid: Det kan ta 2-3 måneder får forebyggende medisiner har full effekt

 Individuell variasjon: Hva som fungerer for en person, fungerer ikke nødvendigvis for en annen

 

 Det positive er at mange opplever at anfallene blir mindre intense og sjeldnere med Ørene, spesielt med god behandling og triggerhåndtering. I noen tilfeller kan langvarig vestibulær migrene utvikle seg til PPPD (kronisk svimmelhet), som krever en annen behandlingstilnærming.

Describe diagnosis for Tarsal Tunnel Syndrome.

Diagnosis

 The diagnosis is made primarily clinically. Two tests are particularly useful
 Tinel's sign

 Gentle tapping over the tarsal tunnel behind the inner ankle. Positive when it triggers tingling or pain into the foot. 58-82% sensitivity - useful but not sufficient alone.

 Dorsiflexion-eversion test

 The ankle is bent upward and turned outward for 5-10 seconds. This test has 81.8% sensitivity and 85.7% specificity - one of the best clinical tests for the condition (Kinoshita et al. 2001).

 Imaging

 Ultrasound is increasingly important, particularly for detecting ganglion cysts, vascular causes and swelling. Chiropractors can order this directly. MRI is relevant when a space-occupying lesion is suspected.

 Nerve conduction studies (NCS/EMG) can objectively confirm the diagnosis, but sensitivity varies (50-90%).

HLA-B27

 90-95% positiv 

 Et gen som finnes hos de fleste med Bekhterevs. Men: 8% av normalbefolkningen har også dette genet uten å få sykdommen. Positiv test er støttende, men ikke diagnostisk alene.

Betennelsesmarkorer

Røntgen bekken

Describe Pressure-Induced Dizziness (Hennebert Sign) in the context of Superior Canal Dehiscence Syndrome (SCDS).

Pressure-Induced Dizziness (Hennebert Sign)

 Affects 37% and is triggered by Valsalva maneuver (straining), coughing, sneezing, heavy lifting or nose blowing.

 

 Chronic unsteadiness and balance problems affect many, and up to 50% report mental fatigue and brain fog.

 Auditory Symptoms (Hearing Disturbances)

 
 Autophony

 The most characteristic symptom, affecting 42-60% of patients. Patients describe their own voice as sounding distorted or "metallic," and many hear their own body sounds abnormally loud - such as eye movements, footsteps, heartbeat and even bowel sounds. This is almost diagnostic for SCDS when present.

 

 
 Pulsatile Tinnitus: Occurs in 20-50% and is experienced as a "whooshing" sound synchronous with pulse

 Hearing Loss in Low Frequencies: Affects approximately 40%, typically in the 250-1000 Hz range

 Fullness Sensation in Ear: Reported by over 60%

 
 

 
 
 4
 Differential Diagnoses - What Can It Resemble?

 

 SCDS is called "the great imitator of the ear" because symptoms can resemble several other conditions:

 
 Meniere's Disease

 Also causes hearing loss and dizziness, but attacks come spontaneously and last 20 minutes to several hours. In SCDS, symptoms are temporally related to specific sound or pressure triggers.

Describe causes for Trigeminal Neuralgia.

Causes

 Trigeminal neuralgia is divided into three main categories based on cause
 Classical TN (most common)

 In this form, a blood vessel - most often the superior cerebellar artery - compresses the trigeminal nerve where it enters the brainstem. The pressure damages the nerve insulation (myelin), leading to "short-circuiting" between nerve fibers. The result is intense pain signals triggered by normally harmless touch.

 Secondary TN

 In this form, TN is caused by another disease
 Multiple sclerosis (MS) - the most common secondary cause. 2-5% of MS patients develop TN (StatPearls 2024; Lancet Neurol 2020)

 Tumor in the brainstem region

 Vascular malformations 

 Idiopathic TN

 No cause is found on MRI. The pain is identical to the classical variant, but neither vascular compression nor other underlying disease is detected.

 TN in people under 40 years of age

 Onset of trigeminal neuralgia under age 40 should always be investigated for secondary causes, especially MS (StatPearls 2024). Bilateral TN further strengthens this suspicion.

Ofte stilte spørsmål

 

 
 Hjelper ergonomisk mus?

 En ergonomisk mus kan redusere belastningen på handleddet, men forskning viser at den alene ikke forebygger eller behandler musearm. Den bør kombineres med styrketrening og pauser.

 

 
 Hvor ofte bør jeg ta pauser?

 Ideelt sett en kort mikropause (30-60 sekunder) hver 20-30 minutter, og en lengre pause (5-10 minutter) hver time. Beveg deg og rist ut armene i pausene.

 

 
 Hvilke Øvelser hjelper?

 StyrkeØvelser for nakke, skuldre og armer er viktigst. Eksempler: skulderhev, roØvelser, grip-Øvelser, og eksentriske Øvelser for underarmene.

 

 
 Kan jeg fortsette å jobbe?

 Ja, med tilpasninger. Hyppigere pauser, variasjon i arbeidsoppgaver, og et treningsprogram kan gjøre at du kan jobbe uten å forverre plagene.

 

 
 Når bør jeg søke hjelp?

 Hvis plagene vedvarer over 2-3 uker til tross for pauser og tilpasninger, eller hvis du opplever nummenhet, svakhet eller tiltagende symptomer.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Trigger Finger: Complete Guide.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Does trigger finger go away on its own?

 Yes, studies show that 52% of mild cases resolve spontaneously, especially with
 rest and time.

 

 
 Does cortisone help?

 Yes, cortisone injection has 63-80% success rate. This is often the first choice
 when rest alone is not enough.

 

 
 Is shockwave treatment effective?

 No. A new systematic review from 2024 (Brancaccio et al.) shows ESWT has no proven
 effect for trigger finger. This is in contrast to conditions like tennis
 elbow where there is some support.

 

 
 Do I need surgery?

 Most people don't. But for those who don't respond to cortisone, surgery (A1
 release) has over 90% success rate.

Describe Why Is This So Confusing? for Sciatica, Disc Herniation or Lumbago?.

Why Is This So Confusing?

 

 
 Most people with back pain google their symptoms. The terms "lumbago", "disc herniation" and "sciatica" appear interchangeably - often used as if they mean the same thing. They don't.
 

 
 The problem is that symptoms can overlap, and many believe they have a serious injury when the pain is actually caused by something far less dramatic. Around 85-95% of all back pain is non-specific, meaning without a detectable structural cause (WHO, 2023). True disc herniation with nerve involvement accounts for less than 5% of cases (StatPearls, 2024).

Beskriv behandlingsalternativer for Golfalbue: Alt du trenger å vite.

Evidensbasert behandling

 

 Det gode nyheten: 85-96% av pasienter med golfalbue blir bra med konservativ behandling. Kirurgi er sjelden nødvendig.

 
 Gullstandard: Eksentrisk trening

 
 Gradvis styrking av fleksorsenene

 Stimulerer kollagenproduksjon og seneoppbygging

 Eksentriske "wrist curls" med lett vekt

 3 sett x 15 repetisjoner, 2 ganger daglig

 
 

 Behandlingsplan hos Kiropraktor Mads Finstad

 
 1. Grundig undersøkelse

 Vurdere om ulnarnerven er involvert, utelukke differensialdiagnoser, og kartlegge provoserende faktorer.

 

 
 2. Manuell behandling

 Bløtvevsbehandling av triggerpunkter i fleksormuskulaturen, mobilisering av albue og handledd, eventuelt nerveglide for ulnarnerven.

 

 
 3. Eksentrisk trening Viktigst

 Strukturert treningsprogram med fokus på eksentrisk belastning av fleksorene. Reverse wrist curls med gradvis Økt motstand.

 

 
 4. Ergonomisk veiledning

 Identifisere og modifisere provoserende aktiviteter på jobb og i fritid.

 

 
 Eksentrisk wrist curl for golfalbue

 
 Sitt med underarmen på et bord, handflaten opp, handleddet utenfor bordkanten

 Hold en lett vekt (0.5-1 kg) i handen

 Start med handleddet bøyd opp (fleksert)

 Senk vekten sakte ned (3-4 sekunder) til handleddet er strakt

 Bruk den andre handen til å løfte tilbake til start

 Gjenta 15 ganger, 3 sett, 2 ganger daglig

 
 Tips: Noe ubehag er OK, men stopp ved skarp smerte.

Describe treatment options for SI Joint Problems and Pelvic Dysfunction.

Treatment

 

 Chiropractic Treatment

 SI joint problems are one of the most common conditions chiropractors treat, and the results are often
 good.

 
 Joint manipulation - specific adjustment of the SI joint to restore normal function
 

 Mobilization - gentler techniques for those who prefer them

 Soft tissue treatment - of tight muscles around the pelvis

 Taping - can provide support in the acute phase

 

 Stabilization Exercises

 Exercise is important to prevent recurrence. Focus on:

 
 Core stability - transversus abdominis, multifidus

 Hip muscles - gluteus medius and maximus

 Pelvic floor - often underestimated

 Balance and coordination

 

 
 What can you expect?

 
 Many notice improvement after 1-3 treatments

 Most are significantly better within 4-8 weeks

 Maintenance exercises reduce the risk of recurrence

 
 

 Self-Help

 
 Avoid asymmetric loading - don't stand on one leg for long

 Pillow between the knees when lying on your side

 Move regularly - avoid prolonged sitting

 Heat can relieve stiffness

 SI belt can provide temporary support

 A recent systematic review from 2025 found that manual therapy combined with exercises targeting neck and jaw reduced tinnitus severity and improved quality of life - both immediately and at 3- and 6-month follow-up.

 
 Impressive Treatment Results

 
 Wright and Bifano (1997): 52.5% achieved complete recovery from tinnitus, another 30% became significantly better - total 82.5% response rate

 Wright (2007): In 200 patients, 83% reported significant improvement or complete absence of tinnitus after TMD treatment

 Systematic review 2024: Multidisciplinary, non-invasive approaches were well-documented

 
 

 What Can the Chiropractor Do?

 Norwegian guidelines from the Health Directorate specifically mention chiropractors as qualified practitioners for TMD. Treatment focuses on conservative, reversible interventions:

 
 Manual treatment of jaw muscles: Soft tissue treatment and trigger point therapy of masseter, temporalis and pterygoid muscles

 Jaw joint mobilization: Gentle mobilization to improve movement

 Intraoral treatment: Of pterygoid muscles when needed

 Neck treatment: Cervico-mandibular manual therapy showed large effects on tinnitus severity in RCT from 2020

 Exercises: Mobility, strength and relaxation exercises for jaw and neck

 Patient education: Information about the condition, advice on stress management and habit modification

 

 What Can You Do Yourself?

 
 Rest position: Lips together, teeth apart, tong...

Red Flags - When to See a Doctor

 

 
 Seek medical attention immediately for:

 
 Sudden, intense foot pain without obvious cause

 Swelling, redness and warmth combined with fever

 Numbness or tingling that doesn't go away

 Foot ulcers that don't heal (especially with diabetes)

 Significant worsening of pain during or after training

 Cracking or crunching sounds followed by acute pain

 
 

 Mild muscle soreness after foot training is normal, especially at the start. But sharp pain, numbness, or swelling are signs that you should take a break and possibly seek evaluation.

Hva er tekstnakke?: Begrepet ble først brukt av den amerikanske kiropraktoren Dean Fishman i 2008. Når du holder hodet i nøytral posisjon, veier det omtrent 4,5-5,5 kg. En biomekanisk studie fra 2014 viste at belastningen på nakken øker dramatisk ved fremoverbøyning
Årsaker og risikofaktorer: Den klart vanligste årsaken til tekstnakke er rett og slett tiden man tilbringer med hodet bøyd over mobilen, nettbrettet eller PC-en. En metaanalyse fra 2025 fant at overdreven smarttelefonbruk gir 2,34 ganger høyere risiko for nakkesmerter. Blant kontorarbeidere var risikoen enda høyere - 6 ganger økt risiko .

Symptomer: En norsk studie basert på Ungdata-undersøkelsen (253.968 ungdommer) viste at 24% av norske ungdommer hadde nakke- og skuldersmerter, og blant jenter med slike plager hadde 70% også hodepine.

Behandling: En systematisk gjennomgang fra 2023 fant at kombinasjonen av manuell terapi og stabiliseringsøvelser ga bedre resultater enn trening alene for pasienter med forward head posture og kroniske nakkesmerter.

Beskriv symptomer og kjennetegn for Plantar Fasciopati.

Symptomer

 

 Det mest karakteristiske symptomet er intens hælsmerte ved de første skrittene om morgenen - søkalt startsmerte. Smerten oppstar fordi plantarfascien trekker seg sammen i løpet av natten mens foten hviler, og de plutselige belastningene ved å stå opp forårsaker strekksmerte.

 Typiske kjennetegn

 
 Smerten er lokalisert til undersiden av hålen, ofte litt mot innsiden

 Ømhet ved trykk på hælfestet (medialt calcaneus-tuberkel)

 Smerten bedres typisk etter noen minutters gange

 Kan forverres igjen ved langvarig aktivitet eller ståing

 Omtrent en tredjedel har plager i begge fåtter

 

 
 Diagnostikk

 Diagnosen stilles primært klinisk, basert på sykehistorie og fysisk undersøkelse. Typisk lokalisert Ømhet over hælfestet og positiv Windlass-test (smerte når tårne bøyes bakover) bekrefter diagnosen i de fleste tilfeller. Det er viktig å skille tilstanden fra andre Årsaker til fotsmerter som Morton's nevrom eller metatarsalgi.

 Bildediagnostikk er normalt ikke nødvendig ved oppstart. Ultralyd vurderes ved manglende respons etter 3 måneder.

Describe diagnosis for SLAP Lesion: Everything You Need to Know.

Diagnosis

 Diagnosing SLAP lesion is challenging and often requires a combination of clinical findings and
 imaging.

 Clinical tests

 Several tests have been described, but none have high enough accuracy alone
 O'Brien's test (Active compression): Most used, but moderate sensitivity

 Biceps load test: Positive with external rotation against resistance

 Anterior slide test 

 Crank test 

 Limitations of tests

 A meta-analysis showed that even the best clinical tests have limited accuracy. Combination of
 several positive tests increases the probability, but the diagnosis can rarely be made clinically
 alone.

 Imaging

 MR arthrography (gold standard)

 MRI with contrast injected into the joint. Provides the best visualization of the labrum and can
 distinguish between different types of SLAP lesions. Sensitivity around 80-90%.

 Regular MRI

 Can detect SLAP lesions, but has lower sensitivity than MR arthrography. Useful for looking for
 concomitant pathology (rotator cuff, etc.).

 Important caveats

 Even MR arthrography has false-positive findings

 SLAP changes are common in asymptomatic individuals

 MRI findings must always be correlated with clinical findings

 Age over 40: Type I changes are often normal findings

What is the prognosis for Anterior Canal BPPV: The Rare Variant?

Prognosis

 

 Anterior canal BPPV generally has good prognosis:

 
 
 85.6%
 achieve symptom relief
 

 
 78.8%
 success with Yacovino
 

 
 0.7-3%
 of all BPPV cases
 

 

 
 Self-Limiting Condition

 The anatomical position means that the condition more often resolves on its own than other variants. Crystals drain out more easily due to the canal's vertical orientation.

 

 Recurrence

 BPPV in general has significant recurrence risk: 13.7-23% recurrence within the first year, 22-50% recurrence over 5 years.

Differential diagnoses for Cervical Myelopathy?

mJOA scale (modified Japanese Orthopaedic Association)

 The most widely used classification method for severity (Tetreault et al., Global Spine J 2017)
 Severity 
 mJOA score 
 Recommended action 

 Normal 
 18 
 None 

 Mild 
 15-17 
 Structured observation or surgery 

 Moderate 
 12-14 
 Surgery recommended 

 Severe 
 Below 12 
 Surgery strongly recommended

MRI (magnetic resonance imaging) — gold standard

 MRI is the most important investigation when cervical myelopathy is suspected (AO Spine guidelines). MRI shows
 Degree of spinal cord compression — how narrow the canal is

 T2 hyperintensity in the spinal cord — signal changes suggesting tissue involvement

 T1 hypointensity — a more serious sign that may indicate permanent changes

 Number of levels affected

 The cause — spondylosis, herniation, OPLL, or other

CT and X-ray

 CT provides better visualization of bony structures and is useful for evaluating osteophytes and OPLL. X-ray can show degenerative changes, instability, and alignment of the spine, but cannot visualize the spinal cord directly.

Describe Is Sever's Disease Dangerous? for Sever's Disease.

Is Sever's Disease Dangerous?

 

 No, Sever's disease is completely harmless and causes no permanent damage. It is a
 common, benign growth pain that resolves on its own when the growth plate in the heel closes.

 
 The good news

 
 The condition always resolves on its own

 No permanent damage or deformities

 Does not affect the child's growth or development

 The child can usually continue with sports (with modifications)

 
 

 The most important thing is to manage the pain so that the child can stay active and avoid long periods
 of inactivity. Complete rest is rarely necessary.

Describe causes and risk factors for Piriformis Syndrome: False Sciatica.

Causes and risk factors

 Piriformis syndrome is typically divided into primary (congenital anatomical cause) and secondary (acquired) types. The secondary type accounts for over 85% of cases (Boyajian-O'Neill et al., 2008).

 Causes ranked from most common to rarest
 Macrotrauma (~50% of cases): Fall on the buttock, direct impact to the hip region, car accidents

 Overuse/microtrauma: Running, cycling, repetitive hip movements over time

 Prolonged sitting: Office workers, truck and taxi drivers

 Anatomical variations (10-16%): The sciatic nerve may have an unusual course through or over the piriformis muscle

 Postoperative (rare): After hip replacement or back surgery

Differential diagnoses for Headache on Top of the Head?

Tension Headache

 Most common - 46% lifetime 

 Tension headache is by far the most common cause of headache on top of the head. Lifetime prevalence is 46% globally, and Danish studies show up to 78%. Women are affected twice as often as men.

 Typical presentation is bilateral, pressing or tightening pain - often described as a "band around the head" that can focus on the top. The pain is mild to moderate and does not worsen with physical activity.

 Risk factors: Stress, poor sleep, prolonged screen work and static work postures.

Trigger Points in Neck Musculature

 Referred pain 

 Muscles in the neck can refer pain to the top of the head through a phenomenon called "referred pain." Read more about trigger points and headache .

 Splenius capitis is the primary muscle that sends pain specifically to the crown. Trigger points in this muscle - located approximately at the C3 level - create a characteristic pain sensation in a 3-5 cm zone in the middle of the top of the head. Patients often describe this as "internal head pain" or "pressure on the crown."

 Suboccipital muscles (the small muscles at the very top of the neck) are found to have active trigger points in 65% of patients with chronic tension headache. These muscles have a direct anatomical connection to the meninges.

Cervicogenic Headache

 2.5-4.1% of population 

 Cervicogenic headache is caused by dysfunction in the upper cervical vertebrae (C1-C3) and surrounding structures. The Norwegian Vaga study found 4.1% prevalence.

 This type of headache typically starts in the neck and radiates upward toward the top of the head on one side. The pain worsens with neck movements and sustained postures.

Occipital Neuralgia

 Rare 

 Occipital neuralgia causes sharp, shooting pain from the back of the head that can radiate to the top of the head. The pain follows the course of the occipital nerve and is often unilateral with periods of intense "lightning-like" pain.

Medication Overuse Headache

 0.5-7.

Beskriv Ribbeinslasning (costovertebral dysfunksjon) i kontekst av Ribbeinslasning vs. Ribbeinsbrudd.

Ribbeinslasning (costovertebral dysfunksjon)

 Ribbeinslasning handler ikke om brudd i det hele tatt. Her er det leddene mellom ribbein og ryggsøylen (costovertebralleddene) som har blitt stive eller "last" - de beveger seg ikke slik de skal.

 Tilstanden oppstar ofte uten noe klart traume. En bråbevegelse, tung løfting, langvarig dårlig holdning, eller bare en uheldig vridning kan våre nok.

Beskriv årsaker og risikofaktorer for Skulderbladssmerte og Cervikal Radikulopati.

2 Årsaker og risikofaktorer

 Hvorfor gir nakkeproblemer skulderbladssmerte?

 Nervene fra nakken (C4-C8) har forgreninger som innerverer muskulaturen og huden rundt skulderbladene. Når en nerverot irriteres, kan smerten oppleves der nerven ender - ikke der problemet sitter.

 Fra vanligst til sjeldnest

 Muskulær spenning/myofasiell smerte: Triggerpunkter i rhomboider og trapezius. Vanligst. Ofte relatert til kontorarbeid

 Cervikal referert smerte/radikulopati: Underdiagnostisert. Bør mistenkes når smerten forverres ved nakkebevegelser

 Brystryggdysfunksjon: Stivhet i brystrygg-segmentene og costovertebral-dysfunksjon

 Skulderpatologi: Scapulær dyskinesi, rotator cuff 

 Visceral referert smerte: Hjertesykdom (venstre skulderblad), gallesten (høyre skulderblad) - sjeldent, men viktig å utelukke

 Hvilke nakkenivåer gir skulderbladssmerte?

 Mizutamari et al. (2011) kartla smertmønstrene hos 180 pasienter
 C5: Over skulderbladstoppen (suprascapulært)

 C6: Fra skulderbladstoppen mot baksiden av skulderen

 C7: Mellom skulderbladene (interscapulært) - vanligst

 C8: Mellom og rundt skulderbladene

Søvnforstyrrelser

 God søvn blir vanskeligere utover i svangerskapet. Mange gravide sliter med å finne en komfortabel sovestilling, må opp flere ganger om natten, og har generelt urolig søvn. Dårlige soveposisjoner kan føre til stiv og smertefull nakke om morgenen.

Describe causes and risk factors for Text Neck and Phone Neck.

Causes and Risk Factors

 Prolonged screen use in forward-bent position (most common)

 The clearly most common cause of text neck is simply the time spent with the head bent over the phone, tablet or PC. A meta-analysis from 2025 found that excessive smartphone use gives 2.34 times higher risk of neck pain. Among office workers, the risk was even higher - 6 times increased risk .

 Poor workplace ergonomics

 Screen placed too low, chair without support, or lack of height adjustment contributes to the neck being held in unfavorable positions hour after hour.

 Lack of breaks and movement

 Static work without micro-breaks overloads the neck musculature. Health guidelines recommend varied activity, different work positions and frequent micro-breaks.
Kort vurdering: Postoperativ rehab etter ACL-rekonstruksjon, 6 uker postop.

Rehabiliteringsvurdering - 6 uker post ACL-rekonstruksjon

Forventede milepæler 6 uker:
- Full ekstensjon (lik kontralateral side)
- Fleksjon 90-110°
- Gange uten krykker og uten halting
- God quadriceps-aktivering (straight leg raise uten lag)
- Redusert hevelse

Undersøkelse:
- ROM: Aktiv/passiv fleksjon og ekstensjon, sammenlign sider
- Hevelse: Omkretsemåling 1cm over patella
- Muskelaktivering: SLR, quadriceps setting, VMO kontroll
- Gangmønster: Observere for antalgisk mønster
- Arr: Vurder tilheling, mobilitet

Behandlingsfokus (Uke 6-12):
- ROM: Oppnå full fleksjon gradvis
- Styrke: Lukkede kjede-øvelser (squat, leg press, step-up)
- Propriosepsjon: Balansebrett, ettbensbalanse
- Gangtrening: Normalisere gangmønster
- Sykkel (lav motstand)
- Arrmobilisering

Ikke tillatt ennå:
- Løping (vanligvis fra 12-16 uker)
- Pivotering/retningsendring
- Kontaktsport (6-9 mnd minimum)

Explain prognosis for Dizzy When Lying Down? What You Need to Know About BPPV.

Prognosis

 With treatment: The outlook is generally very good. Over 90% achieve complete symptom relief with proper treatment. Many notice significant improvement immediately after the repositioning maneuver.

 Without treatment

 BPPV often resolves on its own, but it takes time: only 4% are better after one week, 18% after one month, and 51% after one year. Given how bothersome the condition is, treatment provides significantly faster improvement.

 Recurrence

 It's important to be prepared that BPPV can return
 10-18% have recurrence within one year

 About 22% within five years

 Up to 50% over 10 years

 Higher risk of recurrence is seen in people with migraine, diabetes, high blood pressure, osteoporosis, and vitamin D deficiency. Vitamin D supplementation can significantly reduce recurrence risk.

Gi en strukturert klinisk oversikt over Lumbal Foraminal Stenose.

Hva er foraminal stenose?: Langs hele ryggraden finnes det åpninger på begge sider mellom hver virvel. De heter foramen intervertebrale, og gjennom dem passerer nerverøttene ut fra ryggmargen på vei til resten av kroppen. Tenk på det som tunneler for nervene.

Årsaker: Foraminal stenose skyldes nesten alltid aldersrelaterte forandringer. De vanligste årsakene, rangert etter hyppighet
Symptomer: Foraminal stenose og isjias (fra prolaps) kan gi lignende symptomer. Begge gir utstråling til benet. Men det finnes forskjeller
Diagnostikk: Vi tester nervefunksjon systematisk: reflekser, kraft, følsomhet og spesifikke provokasjonstester. Kemps test - der vi kombinerer bakoverbenging med rotasjon mot den smertefulle siden - kan reprodusere symptomene ved foraminal stenose.

Konservativ behandling hos kiropraktor: Konservativ behandling er førstevalg for foraminal stenose. Alle retningslinjer anbefaler å prøve konservativ behandling i 3-6 måneder før kirurgi vurderes (AFP, 2024).

What warning signs should be monitored for Diagnostic Imaging?

Overdiagnosis causes harm

 Webster and Cifuentes ( JOEM 2010) found that early MRI for common back pain was associated with an 8 times higher surgery rate — without better outcomes. Norway's "Choosing Wisely" campaign is clear: avoid MRI in the first six weeks for uncomplicated back pain.

Gi en strukturert klinisk oversikt over Slik å delegger en stiv rygg for golfsvingen og tennisserven din.

NØkkeltall om brystrygg og idrett: Brystryggen bidrar med mesteparten av rotasjonen i overkroppen. Når denne blir stiv, må andre strukturer kompensere - ofte med negative konsekvenser.

Golferen: Når korsryggen tar ståyten: Golfsvingens kraft kommer fra det forskerne kaller «kinetisk kjede» - en koordinert overfåring av energi fra bakken, gjennom bena, hoftene og trunken, og ut i armene og kølla. En studie av Nesbit og Serrano fra 2005 viste at rygg og hofteledd til sammen star for 68-72% av det totale arbeidet i en golfsving.

Tennisspilleren: Serven som avslærer stivheten: Tennisserven er en av de mest krevende bevegelsene i idrett. Kibler og kollegaer etablerte allerede i 1995 at ben, hofter og trunkus samlet bidrar med omtrent 51% av kinetisk energi og 54% av total kraft i en serve. Resten kommer fra skulder, arm og håndledd.

Løperen: Når pusten blir begrenset: Hyperkyfose - overdreven krumning av brystryggen - påvirker ikke bare bevegelse, men også pustekapasiteten. Les mer om sammenhengen mellom pust, stress og rygg . Framingham-studien, som fulgte deltakere over 16 år, fant at kvinner med uttalt kyfose hadde målbart større nedgang i lungefunksjon over tid sammenlignet med de med normal holdning (Lorbergs et al., 2017).

Hvorfor kompensasjon fører til skade: Kroppen er bemerkelsesverdig god til å finne omveier når hovedveien er blokkert. Problemet er at disse omveiene ofte har lavere kapasitet og høyere å bompenger». Ved langvarige brystryggsmerter kan muskulaturen mellom skulderbladene bli overbelastet.

Hva kan gjøres?: Behandling av stiv brystrygg fokuserer på å gjenopprette normal bevegelighet gjennom en kombinasjon av manuelle teknikker og øvelser. En systematisk gjennomgang i BMJ Open Sport & Exercise Medicine (Spencer et al., 2020) identifiserte 38 ulike brystryggsøvelser brukt i idrettssammenheng, men påpekte at det mangler randomiserte kontrollerte studier spesifikt for idrettsutøvere.

Describe symptoms and signs of Chronic Dizziness and PPPD.

Symptoms and Characteristics

 

 Main Symptoms:

 
 Non-rotational dizziness: It doesn't spin, but it rocks, sways or feels like being on a boat

 Brain fog: Concentration difficulties, mental fatigue - reported by about 81%

 Exhaustion: Extreme tiredness, worst in the afternoon - reported by about 85%

 Visual hypersensitivity: Worsening in busy environments (shopping centers, supermarkets)

 Movement intolerance: Symptoms worsen with both active and passive movements (car, bus)

 

 Mental Health and PPPD

 60% of PPPD patients have clinically significant anxiety and 45% have depression, but 25% have no psychiatric condition at all. This underscores that PPPD is a neurological condition - not "just anxiety." Similar mental health challenges are also seen in other chronic dizziness conditions like Meniere's disease and MdDS.

 
 Red Flags - Call 113 or go to emergency room for:

 
 Acute dizziness with headache - especially "the worst headache ever"

 Double vision, visual disturbances or visual field loss

 Speech difficulties or swallowing problems

 Numbness, weakness or paralysis in face, arm or leg

 Sudden one-sided hearing loss

 Dizziness with chest pain or palpitations

Diskogen smerte

 Skivene mellom ryggvirvlene kan våre en smertekilde, selv uten at det foreligger prolaps. Trykk på skivens ytterste lag (annulus) kan gi lokal korsryggsmerte.

 

 Risikofaktorer:

 
 Stillasittende livsstil eller fysisk krevende arbeid

 Tidligere episoder med korsryggsmerter

 Dårlig kjernemuskulatur

 Stress og psykososiale faktorer

 Røyking Øker risikoen for ryggsmerter

 Overvekt

 
 

 
 
 
 3
 Symptomer på hekseskudd

 

 Symptomene ved hekseskudd er typisk lokalisert til korsryggen og kan variere i intensitet:

 Karakteristiske symptomer:

 
 Akutt smerte: Plutselig innsettende, ofte beskrevet som "stikkende" eller "lammende"

 Stivhet: Betydelig redusert bevegelighet i ryggen

 Muskelspenning: Ofte palbar spenning i ryggmuskulaturen

 Smerteførsterking: Bevegelse, hosting, nysing og anstrengelse forverrer smertene

 Lettelse i hvile: Smertene avtar ofte i stillestende stillinger

 

 
 Viktig skille: Ukomplisert vs. komplisert

 Ved ukomplisert hekseskudd er smertene begrenset til korsryggen uten utstrålende symptomer til beina. Dersom du opplever utstrålende smerter, nummenhet eller kraftsvikt i beina, kan dette tyde på nerveaffeksjon (isjias) og bør vurderes av helsepersonell.

What is the prognosis for T4 Syndrome: When Upper Thoracic Spine Causes Hand Symptoms?

Prognosis

 

 There are no published data on long-term prognosis or recurrence rates for T4 syndrome. What is known is
 based on case reports and clinical experience:

 
 What We Know

 
 Short-term Prognosis

 Case reports often describe rapid symptom relief after manual treatment - some patients experience
 immediate improvement, others gradual improvement over weeks. Hirai & Thomson (2016) reported
 complete symptom resolution after manipulation treatment.

 

 
 Recurrence Risk

 NHS Scotland suggests that the clinical course probably resembles back and neck complaints in general
 - meaning recurrence is common, and symptoms may have an episodic pattern. Continued attention to
 posture and ergonomics is probably important for preventing recurrence.

 

 
 Realistic Expectations

 Most patients who actually have T4 syndrome respond well to treatment. But it's important to remember
 that the diagnosis is uncertain - if treatment doesn't produce results, it may be because the symptoms
 have another cause.

Beskriv Cervikal radikulopati - nerverotsmerter for Nakkesmerter - Komplett guide til Årsaker, behandling og røde flagg.

Cervikal radikulopati - nerverotsmerter

 

 Gå til full artikkel om nakkeprolaps ?

 Når en nerve i nakken kommer i klem, kan det gi utstraling ned i armen, ofte med prikking, nummenhet eller svakhet. Dette kalles cervikal radikulopati og rammer omtrent 0,8-1,8 per 1000 personer Årlig (StatPearls, 2026).

 Til sammenligning har over 30% av befolkningen nakkesmerter hvert Ør, så nerverotaffeksjon er relativt sjelden. Det positive er at prognosen er god: 75-90% blir bedre med konservativ behandling.

 
 Hvilken nerve er påvirket? Symptomguide

 
 C6-nerven (tommel og pekefinger): Nummenhet/prikking i tommel og pekefinger, svakhet ved å bøye albuen (biceps), redusert biceps-refleks

 C7-nerven (langfinger): Vanligst - 60-70% av tilfellene. Nummenhet i langfinger, svakhet ved å strekke albuen (triceps), redusert triceps-refleks

 C8-nerven (ring- og lillefinger): Nummenhet i ring- og lillefinger, svak gripekraft, problemer med fingerbevegelser

 
 

 Karpaltunnel eller nakke? Slik skiller du

 Nummenhet i handen kan komme fra nakken (cervikal radikulopati) eller fra handleddet (karpaltunnelsyndrom). Interessant nok viser en studie at 62,2% av pasienter med cervikal radikulopati også har karpaltunnelsyndrom - sakalt "double crush syndrome".

 
 
 
 Kjennetegn
 Karpaltunnelsyndrom
 Cervikal radikulopati
 
 
 
 
 Hvilke fingre?
 Tommel, pekefinger, langfinger
 Avhenger av nerverot
 
 
 Når verst?
 Om natten, vakner av nummenhet
 Ved nakkebevegelse

Describe Can You See Both? for Chiropractor vs Physiotherapist: What's the Difference?.

Can You See Both?

 

 Absolutely! Many patients combine treatment from both a chiropractor and physiotherapist. For example, a chiropractor can help with acute joint problems, while a physiotherapist follows up with longer-term exercise programs.

 
 The Most Important Thing

 The most important thing is not what title the practitioner has, but that you find a skilled and evidence-based practitioner who takes the time to examine you thoroughly and create a good treatment plan.

 

 Feel free to ask about:

 
 The practitioner's experience with your type of condition

 What you can expect from the treatment

 How many treatments are typically needed

 What you can do yourself between treatments

How is GTPS - Pain on the Outside of the Hip diagnosed?

Diagnosis

 

 The diagnosis is primarily made clinically through history and physical examination.

 Clinical Tests

 
 Palpation of the greater trochanter - tenderness over the bony prominence

 FABER test - reproduces lateral hip pain

 Single leg stance - pain after 30 seconds

 Resisted hip abduction - pain with resistance

 

 Imaging

 MRI can show tendon degeneration, partial tears, or bursitis, but is rarely necessary
 to make the diagnosis. Clinical examination is often sufficient.

 X-ray can rule out osteoarthritis and other bone changes.

Beskriv Hva kan kiropraktoren gjøre? for Scheuermanns sykdom.

Hva kan kiropraktoren gjøre?

 

 Her må man våre Årlig om evidensgrunnlaget: Det finnes per i dag ingen randomiserte kontrollerte studier på kiropraktisk behandling spesifikt for Scheuermanns sykdom. Den tilgjengelige forskningen bestar av kasuistikker (enkeltstående case-rapporter).

 Det betyr ikke at behandling er uten verdi. Basert på klinisk erfaring og generell ryggforskning kan kiropraktisk behandling bidra til:

 
 Kiropraktisk behandling kan bidra til

 
 Forbedret mobilitet i stive brystryggssegmenter

 Reduksjon av muskelspenninger og triggerpunkter

 Bedret ribbebevegelse og pustemekanikk

 Smertelindring gjennom leddmobilisering

 Veiledning om Øvelser og ergonomi

 Funksjonell forbedring selv om strukturen består

 
 

 
 Viktig forventningsavklaring

 Kiropraktisk behandling kan IKKE "rette ut" en strukturell kyfose hos voksne. Målet er symptomlindring og bedre funksjon, ikke strukturell endring.

 

 Behandlingsforløp

 For voksne med symptomgivende Scheuermanns sykdom vil et typisk forløp innebøre en prøveperiode på 6-8 behandlinger over 4-6 uker for å vurdere respons. De fleste som responderer på behandling opplever bedring i smerte og funksjon innen denne perioden. Ved god respons kan vedlikeholdsbehandling med 4-8 ukers intervaller våre nyttig for noen.

 Responsen varierer betydelig fra person til person. Noen har god og varig effekt, andre opplever kun kortvarig lindring, og noen responderer ikke merkbart. En Årlig evaluering etter prøveperioden er vik...
